intro: Drepananthus carinatus var. deltoideus, commonly known as the deltoid leaf sedge, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, acidic soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a distinctive deltoid (triangle-shaped) base on the lower leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the sedge family.
